Maju Calon Ketua Umum, Politikus Golkar Ini Tolak Partai Terbelah
05 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Dewi Nurita, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta ­- Politikus Golkar Indra Bambang Utoyo menyatakan siap maju sebagai calon ketua umum di Munas Golkar pada Desember mendatang. Dia siap bersaing dengan dua calon lainnya yang sudah terlebih dahulu menggalang dukungan yakni, Airlangga Hartarto dan Bambang Soesatyo.
“Saya maju dong, walaupun DPD itu sebetulnya sudah digalang habis oleh AH (Airlangga Hartarto) dan BS (Bambang Soesatyo),” ujar Indra saat dihubungi Tempo pada Selasa malam, 5 Oktober 2019.
Sadar peluangnya sangat kecil, Indra menyatakan akan tetap maju agar Golkar tidak terpecah dua seperti Munas Golkar lima tahun lalu. Ketika itu, terjadi pertarungan sengit antara Aburizal Bakrie dan Agung Laksono yang menghasilkan Munas Ancol dan Munas Bali.
“Setelah dua tahun kisruh, presiden ikut campur dan terjadi lagi Munas, Setya Novanto terpilih. Konsolidasi Golkar terganggu, malah SN masuk KPK. Saya tidak ingin Golkar terpecah dua lagi,” ujar Indra menguraikan.
Selain Indra, calon lainnya yang disebut-sebut akan maju adalah Ridwan Hisjam. Indra berharap lebih banyak kader yang mau mencalonkan diri. “Lebih banyak, lebih bagus, supaya tidak terbelah dua,” ujar dia lagi.
Rapat Pleno Partai Golkar telah menetapkan jadwal Munas Golkar akan dilangsungkan di Jakarta, pada 4-6 Desember 2019. Rapat pleno ini juga menetapkan susunan penyelenggara Munas. Ketua penyelenggara dipegang Melchias Marcus Mekeng, dengan steering committee Ibnu Munzir, kemudian panitia pelaksana Adies Kadier.
Sejauh ini, hanya Bamsoet yang ditengarai akan menjadi calon kuat pesaing Airlangga. Bamsoet sebelumnya mengklaim, menjelang Munas, para pendukungnya semakin militan karena tak dirangkul oleh Airlangga. Bamsoet menyebut, daerah-daerah pun menilai tak ada niat baik dari Airlangga untuk merangkul semua pihak yang sedang berkontestasi di Golkar.
Atas alasan-alasan itulah, Bamsoet yang kini menjadi Ketua MPR RI mengatakan para pendukung mendesaknya untuk maju sebagai calon ketua umum Golkar di musyawarah nasional.

Forward Candidates for General Chairperson, Golkar Politicians Reject Split Party
05 Nov 2019, 19:30 by Dewi Nurita, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Golkar politician Indra Bambang Utoyo said he was ready to go forward as a candidate for chairman in the Golkar National Conference in December. He is ready to compete with two other candidates who have already garnered support, namely Airlangga Hartarto and Bambang Soesatyo.
"I am going forward, even though the DPD has actually been raised by AH (Airlangga Hartarto) and BS (Bambang Soesatyo)," Indra said when contacted by Tempo on Tuesday night, October 5, 2019.
Realizing that the opportunity was very small, Indra stated that he would continue to advance so that Golkar would not be divided into two, like the Golkar National Conference five years ago. At that time, there was a fierce battle between Aburizal Bakrie and Agung Laksono which resulted in the Ancol National Conference and the Bali National Conference.
"After two years of chaos, the president intervened and another National Conference took place, Setya Novanto was elected. Golkar's consolidation was disrupted, instead SN entered the KPK. I don't want Golkar to split in two, "Indra explained.
Besides Indra, another candidate who is said to be advancing is Ridwan Hisjam. Indra hopes that more cadres want to run for office. "The more, the better, so it does not split in two," he said again.
The Golkar Party Plenary Meeting has set the schedule for the Golkar National Conference to be held in Jakarta, 4-6 December 2019. This plenary meeting also established the composition of the National Conference organizers. The chair of the organizer was held by Melchias Marcus Mekeng, with steering committee Ibnu Munzir, then the executive committee Adies Kadier.
So far, only Bamsoet is suspected to be a strong candidate for Airlangga's competitors. Bamsoet had previously claimed, before the National Conference, his supporters were increasingly militant because they were not embraced by Airlangga. Bamsoet said, the regions also considered that there was no good intention from Airlangga to embrace all parties who were contesting in Golkar.
For these reasons, Bamsoet, who is now the Chairperson of the Indonesian People's Consultative Assembly, said supporters urged him to step forward as Golkar's general chairperson in the national assembly.
